item.title: Like WiFi, the USB gets into a funky state every so often on the Microsoft Surface Book 2 and the only way to fix it is to reboot
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Like WiFi, the USB gets into a funky state every so often on the Microsoft Surface Book 2 and the only way to fix it is to reboot. This works fine on Mac just like WiFi works fine on Mac. Sad but true! Shouldn't happen if the computer is made and designed by the same company that made the operating system, right :-) ?!?!
  • Otherwise still very happy with this computer.
  • WSL works great, screen is great, etc etc

item.title: MongoDB queries showing less than, greater than resulting in: Number of English only, 1 and 2 star: Non replied to Firefox for Android reviews November 14, 2017 - April 18, 2018 is: 3962
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Used the following mongodb query from https://github.com/rtanglao/rt-fennec-gplay which returns 3962 documents:

{"synthetic_developer_should_have_replied_but_did_not_reply" : true, 
  "Review Last Update Date and Time": 
    {$gte : "2017-11-14 00:00:00 UTC"},
  "star_rating": { $lt : 3},
  "Reviewer Language": "en"
}

item.title: Staticman: Static site comments by pushing comments to Github and using post commit hook with Pelican Static Site Generator and jekyll
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Two approaches to Staticman: Static site comments by pusing comments to Github and using post commit hook:
    1. Pelican and Staticman: Creating a Static Blog with Search and Comments using the Pelican Static Site Generator
    2. Jekyll and Staticman: Staticman for User-Generated Content on a Jekyll Static Website

item.title: How to convert MongoDB cursor or result iterator to an array in Ruby: use 'to_a()'
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Example in ruby from read-reviews-replies.rb : 
 result_array = reviewsColl.find(
   { 'id' => r1["id"] }).update_one(
     r1, :upsert => true ).to_a

item.title: MongoDB upsert doesn't return updatedExisting boolean instead it returns nModified: 1 for update, 0 for insert
item.description:
Pontifications

result = 
  reviewsColl.find({ 'id' => r1["id"] }).update_one(
    r1, :upsert => true ).ai
logger.debug result.ai
  • The above code for MongoDB 3.6 with latest ruby driver upsert doesn't return updatedExisting boolean instead it returns nModified: 1 for update, 0 for insert

update:

documents=[{"n"=>1, "nModified"=>1, "ok"=>1.0}]"

insert:

documents=[{"n"=>1,
    "nModified"=>0, "upserted"=>[{"index"=>0,
    "_id"=>BSON::ObjectId('5ad4dda1e8bdbe30ca37f700')}], 
    "ok"=>1.0}]"

item.title: How to turn off MongoDB logging in the ruby driver
item.description:
Pontifications

  • I thought I blogged this previously :-) ! I guess I didn't!
Mongo::Logger.logger.level = Logger::FATAL

item.title: Google Play Review Gameplan: devices trend and then history
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Enter the spreadsheets for January - March 2018
  • See if there's a device trend for specific devices like dreamlte aka Samsung S8
  • See if there's a device trend for specific family of devices (like the 19 variants of the Samsung S8 which together form what I will call a "family" e.g. the "Samsung S8" family)
  • Add review history and reply history
  • Devise a workflow for daily updating
  • Update daily somehow :-)

item.title: MongoDB query to find all Samsung S8s in the devices MongoDB collection
item.description:
Pontifications

  • The devices collection (see previous post about Google Play supported devices ) is created as follows using synthetic_add_device_branding_marketing_model.rb and utf8_supported_devices.csv :

How To make the devices collection

 ./synthetic_add_device_branding_marketing_model.rb utf8_supported_devices.csv

How to query for Samung S8

{
  "Retail Branding" : "Samsung",
  "Marketing Name" : /.*S8.*/
}
  • The above query returns 19 rows:
/* 1 */
{
  "_id" : ObjectId("5acbc5561115a9a462b64d58"),
  "Retail Branding" : "Samsung",
  "Marketing Name" : "Galaxy S8",
  "Device" : "SC-02J",
  "Model" : "SC-02J",
  "id" : "36a69c3ac08ae64aeac8f17562b6a6cb651e91b26cf67c70078e45adf4c01c3e",
  "synthetic_branding_plus_marketing_name" : "Samsung Galaxy S8"
}

item.title: NoSQL Manager for MongoDB Professional seems cool but expensive but Windows only, another one to try is RazorSQL any free MongoDB GUI tools on Windows that allow export to CSV?
item.description:
Pontifications

  • NoSQL Manager for MongoDB Professional seems cool but expensive but Windows only, another one to try is RazorSQL as well as a tool I've used on OS X in the past: Studio 3T
  • Any free MongoDB GUI tools on Windows that allow export to CSV?

item.title: Had to Reboot my Surface Book 2 again (twice in two weeks) to get WiFi working, ipconfig dance didn't work
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Had to Reboot my Surface Book 2 again (twice in two weeks) to get WiFi working
  • The ipconfig /release and then ipconfig /renew powershell dance didn't work after a week!
  • Other than this major :-) complaint, really like the computer and Windows 10 especially the Windows Subsystem for Linux.
